programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi try to get the better of some inexperienced new faces on the auction circuit, while Barry attends a sale in Inglewood.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A Roman coin from 44 BC featuring Julius Caesar's portrait is brought into the shop, but it remains to be seen whether the owner will command a high price.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys head down to the shooting range to try out a pair of Duck's Foot pistols, where Chum sets out to prove he is a crack shot.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds' reputation is at stake when a customer claims he was sold a fake watch, and Ashley makes a large offer for some gemstones.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les has to call security when an argument over a missing item turns violent, a high-stakes gambler visits the shop for funds and a customer tries to sell a gynaecologist's table.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: First episode of the series in which Pawn Stars' Rick Dale and his team try to make a profit out of fixing, restoring and transforming unusual objects.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Tyler struggles to stick to his budget during the restoration of a 1930s Eco-Tyre Meter, while Rick gets to work on a storm-damaged street lamp.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The 1989 killing of Indianapolis high school student Amy Weidner while she stayed home from school, and the police's search for the motive - and murderer.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The buyers go to Dallas, where they attend several auctions in one day while facing a frantic race to keep up with the competition.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Ricky and Bubba buy a locker full of valuable sci-fi merchandise, while Victor makes a spectacular profit on his latest purchase.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the multisized worlds of the little and the large. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Pointless co-host Richard Osman and stand-ups Lucy Porter and Phill Jupitus, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the topics of luck and loss. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Top Gear presenter Jeremy Clarkson and broadcasters Sandi Toksvig and Danny Baker, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Question master Stephen Fry continues the comedy quiz's exploration of subjects beginning with the letter L as he asks a range of fiendish questions on the multisized worlds of the little and the large. Joining regular panellist Alan Davies are Pointless co-host Richard Osman and stand-ups Lucy Porter and Phill Jupitus, who are all hoping they don't fall into the QI elves' traps and set off the klaxon.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Nish Kumar, Clara Amfo, Anneka Rice and Al Murray compete in Double Points Friday, and their scores are tallied across the week resulting in an overall champion being crowned.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of with the help of guests Angela Barnes, Ed Gamble, Rhys James, Nish Kumar and Tiff Stevenson. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Kevin Norris and Kieran Chisnall move three state-of-the-art trains, fresh in from Japan. They need to transport them from the North East port of Redcar to a factory in Doncaster.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: How Europe's most advanced power station became a film set. Plus, the structures made by scientific pioneer Nikola Tesla in his quest to provide the US with free electricity.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A young boy falls into a creek and drowns, while his mother is found slumped in the hallway. Dr Stephen Andrews discovers both ingested rat poison, and suspicion falls on the grieving husband and father. The detective soon uncovers a sordid case of extortion and forgery as part of his investigation. Crime drama, starring Mark McManus.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters launch their spring collection for working women to much acclaim, which leads to Beatrice and Evie receiving an offer that has both business and personal consequences. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Connie and Oswald join the holiday to see Billy and Aveline, and Joey's protest about the game shooting on the estate wins him an admirer.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Dancing on Ice
programme.desc: Following on from the launch show over Christmas, Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby host the start of the celebrity skating challenge, joined by judges Christopher Dean, Jayne Torvill, Ashley Banjo and new addition John 'Fabulous' Barrowman. This year's celebrities - six of whom will perform tonight - are Ben Hanlin, Caprice, Joe Swash, Kevin Kilbane, Libby Clegg, Lisa George, Lucrezia Millarini, Maura Higgins, Perri Kiely and Trisha Goddard and - in the show's first same-sex partnership - Ian 'H' Watkins. Michael Barrymore was due to compete, but a broken wrist has ruled him out, and he is replaced by Radzi Chinyanganya.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Rewind The Party Classics
programme.desc: We're all about good times and good tunes! Get in the party mood as we rewind the ultimate party tunes to get you on the dancefloor.

programme.title: Late Night Magic
programme.desc: We're taking you all the way through the night with soem of the best tracks of all time.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: RnB Party: The Friday Rewind
programme.desc: It's Friday which means rewind time. We've got all your favourite hits from Drake, Rihanna, Sean Paul and other massive RnB stars; the perfect way to kick off your weekend.

programme.title: Hit After Hit
programme.desc: Nothing but the biggest hits by your favourite stars back to back.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how seaweed is turned into sushi wrapping, how beer bottles that last for 15 years are made, and how surfers try to keep themselves safe from sharks.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer and Edd China work on an old Aston Martin DB7, hoping to restore it to its former glory but hidden problems threaten to blow their budget.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini revamps his 1934 MG in time for Monterey and heads out on a road trip in his BMC technical support bus.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.sub-title: Tent Find the New Barn Find?
programme.desc: Wayne Carini looks at a Dino that has been left in storage for 15 years and falls in love with it, despite it being infested with mice.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Boiling Bus, Lethal Landslide, Risky Rescue
programme.desc: Footage of near disasters, featuring a bus full of passengers flooding with water, a kayaker trapped inside a waterfall and travellers being swallowed by a landslide.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Tragic Tsunami, Plummeting Plane, Canadian Catastrophe
programme.desc: Footage of near disasters, featuring a train hauling toxic materials crashing into a trapped truck and a plane suffering engine failure while in flight.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An out-of-control car crashes into a bakery, a base jumper is hit hard, a flood strikes a historic town and a rocket explodes just after take-off. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Flash flooding causes havoc in a Spanish village, a liquid petroleum store in Brazil puts a residential area in danger, and a double motorbike crash is caught on camera.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: The winter freeze hits Millinocket in Maine, and disaster strikes when a rookie driver struggles to handle his vehicle on the roads and rolls his rig twice.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and a team of mechanics repair and revamp tired old vehicles.

programme.title: The Detectives: My Killer Case
programme.desc: Disturbing crimes from across the UK are unpacked and retold in intimate detail through police files, CCTV footage and accounts from those who helped solve them.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Forensic Detectives investigates the thin line between love and hate, while tracking the vicious histories of deadly lovers and their evil spouses.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The case of James Eagan Holmes, who, in 2012 killed 12 people at a movie theatre in Aurora, Colorado, and later claimed to be the Joker from the Batman movies.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: A case from Oklahoma, where the Long Branch Saloon was the local hangout for many in the small town of Poteau. However, its beloved proprietor Joe Neff went missing in 2009, leaving behind a splatter of blood. His body was later retrieved from an old mining strip pit, but the identity of his killer remained a mystery.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: How a new DNA testing forensic procedure was introduced during the investigation into the disappearance of a Pennsylvanian woman and her infant son.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: A dog with a large tumour is rescued from a litter-strewn backyard, and Scott sets out to save a pit bull from heavy traffic.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A baby cockatoo has fallen out of its nest, so Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown tries to help it fly once again.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown fights to save Bluebell, who was dumped at the clinic as a kitten and has now fallen victim to a hit-and-run.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.sub-title: I Won the Battle Against My Twin
programme.desc: A bride tries to get her twin sister's approval of her dress, while another customer needs all four of her siblings to agree with her choice of gown.
